title: IT Services Specialist
description:
locations

Toronto, Canada

Ontario, Canada

time type

Full time

posted on

Posted 6 Days Ago

job requisition id

JR109085

Genesys empowers organizations of all sizes to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for their customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the AI-powered Experience Orchestration platform, organizations can accelerate growth by delivering empathetic, personalized experiences at scale to drive customer loyalty, workforce engagement, efficiency and operational improvements.

We employ more than 6,000 people across the globe who embrace empathy and cultivate collaboration to succeed. And, while we offer great benefits and perks like larger tech companies, our employees have the independence to make a larger impact on the company and take ownership of their work. Join the team and create the future of customer experience together.

Genesys IT is currently seeking an IT Services Senior Specialist to join our NA team, to be based out of our Toronto office. This is a rare opportunity for an individual who can build strong relationships, earn trust across the business, and represent IT with professionalism while managing ServiceDesk incidents and requests at an advanced level.

The IT Services Specialist (L2/L3) serves as a key technical resource within the region, providing hands-on support and delivering high-quality customer service to employees across Canadaâ€”including executive leadership. The role is responsible for resolving escalated issues from the Global Helpdesk and junior Desktop team members, managing Tier 2/3 troubleshooting across hardware, software, operating systems, network connectivity, collaboration tools, and all deployed end-user technologies.

In addition to advanced incident resolution, this position supports employee onboarding and offboarding, contributes to device lifecycle operations, and assists in the training and oversight of junior Desktop Specialists under the direction of the team manager. Issues requiring deeper technical expertise will be escalated to L4 subject-matter teams, with the maintaining of ownership for follow-up and ensuring service levels are achieved.

As IT Services evolves with AI-assisted diagnostics, automation, and modern endpoint management, the IT Services Specialist will help drive adoption of these tools to enhance service quality and operational efficiency. The role demands a disciplined approach to process execution and strict adherence to regional compliance requirements, including Sarbanes-Oxley, ISO9001:2008, and ISO27001 frameworks.

This is a hands-on, customer-facing role requiring strong technical proficiency, exceptional communication skills, and the maturity to operate independently. The successful candidate will demonstrate a commitment to continuous improvement while delivering a reliable, frictionless technology experience for users across the region.

Key Responsibilities:

Advanced Support (L2/L3)
â€¢ Serve as the escalation point for complex incidents that cannot be resolved by the Global Helpdesk.
â€¢ Troubleshoot, configure, and repair computer hardware, printers, software, operating systems, and network connectivity issues.
â€¢ Provide hands-on and remote support to users across Canada, including delivering VIP and executive support with discretion and urgency.
â€¢ Coordinate with L3/L4 global teams for advanced troubleshooting and ensure timely incident resolution.
â€¢ Perform installations, maintenance, and repair work on client computing hardware and software.

Operational Service Delivery
â€¢ Support end-user device lifecycle: deployment, operations/support, updates, and retirement.
â€¢ Manage onboarding/offboarding tasks including device preparation, account setup, and new hire orientation support.
â€¢ Maintain accurate asset and software inventory within ServiceNow.
â€¢ Support mobile devices (iOS, Android) including management via Intune Endpoint Management.
â€¢ Configure, maintain, and support Dell PCs, MacBooks, peripherals, and related hardware.
â€¢ Support and maintain audio/visual equipment and meeting room technologies (Zoom, Teams).
â€¢ Perform routine administrative tasks in ServiceNow, Active Directory, Azure AD, and SharePoint.
â€¢ Provide on-site support as needed, including assisting with IT equipment moves and office relocations.
â€¢ Participate in after-hours or on-call rotations based on business needs.
â€¢ Manage hardware order processing, invoice coding, and charge-back procedures in the financial system.

Team Support & Leadership
â€¢ Provide guidance and support to junior Desktop team members on ticket prioritization and handling.
â€¢ Assist with onboarding and training of new team members, supporting skill development and process adherence.
â€¢ Act as deputy when the team manager is unavailable.

Compliance, Quality & Continuous Improvement
â€¢ Adhere to SOX, ISO9001:2008, ISO27001, and corporate compliance requirements.
â€¢ Maintain up-to-date documentation for support processes, workflows, and operational procedures.
â€¢ Identify recurring issues and contribute to improvements in processes, knowledge articles, and service workflows.
â€¢ Drive improvements in MTTR, SLA compliance, and first-time resolution through disciplined troubleshooting.

AI & Modern Support Enablement
â€¢ Use AI-powered diagnostic tools, automated scripts, and virtual agents to accelerate issue resolution.
â€¢ Provide feedback to enhance automated knowledge content and chatbot-driven deflection.
â€¢ Support zero-touch and modern provisioning workflows (Autopilot, Intune) under guidance from engineering teams.
â€¢ Review and interpret endpoint analytics dashboards to help identify emerging support trends.

Cross-Functional Collaboration
â€¢ Work closely with Global IT, Security, HR, and Facilities to ensure smooth service delivery across the region.
â€¢ Support regional IT initiatives, infrastructure deployments, and business events requiring IT presence.

Minimum Requirements:
â€¢ 3-4 years experience of troubleshooting, configuring, and repairing computer hardware, printers, software, network connectivity and operating systems.
â€¢ Strong customer service focus and interpersonal skills is a must.
â€¢ Experience with onboarding and training users
â€¢ Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal in English, with the ability to create rapport with clients, delivering a high level of customer service. The ability to communicate effectively face to face and in writing with people at various levels in an organization is crucial.
â€¢ Ability to work under own initiative with limited guidance being required in own area of knowledge.
â€¢ Demonstrate aptitude for continuous learning and innovative thinking.
â€¢ Able to work with peers on a global scale.
â€¢ Able to work and communicate effectively with more senior IT and business staff
â€¢ Proficiency with Windows OS is required.
â€¢ Experience of supporting mobile devices is preferred (i.e. tablets, smart phones, soft phones etc.).
â€¢ A+ or Microsoft certification preferred.
â€¢ Experience with Mac and Linux OS is preferable.
â€¢ ITIL foundation certification is desirable.
â€¢ Azure AD, Active Directory, Intune, Autopilot, Microsoft Office 365, Basic understanding of TCP/IP connectivity, VPN clients and connectors, Mac OS 10.x and above, Windows 10 and above.
â€¢ Audio and Visual â€“ Zoom
â€¢ Experience with hardware ordering and invoicing

Desirable:

JamF, Business telephony (Cloud and VOIP), IT Security & Access Management principles, Office365/Teams, Service Now.

Personal Attributes
â€¢ Customer-first mindset with strong ownership of service delivery
â€¢ Calm, composed, and reliable in high-pressure situations
â€¢ Team-oriented with mentoring capability
â€¢ Adaptable to emerging tools and technologies, including AI
â€¢ Detail-driven, process-focused, and committed to operational excellence

Additional Comments

Travel across Canada may be required for in-field support, training, business meetings, and regional IT functions (<10%).

title: Information Technology Support Specialist
description:
In this role, you will be joining a global financial services firm. You will be a part of a large IT team that is spread out across Canada, and help manage the IT infrastructure in their Toronto office. You will support Windows 11 and Office 365, and will primarily support with Tier 2 issues.

What you will do and how you will make an impact â€¦
â€¢ Provide user support for Office 365 and Windows products. You will respond to tickets and calls for all offices across Canada.
â€¢ Provide support for Tier 1 - Tier 2 issues. You will diagnose and resolve hardware/software issues for desktops, laptops, printers, and peripherals.
â€¢ Troubleshoot and document issues related to Windows, Office 365, company-specific applications, and network connectivity.
â€¢ Track equipment assignments and maintain accurate records in inventory systems.
â€¢ Set up and support PCs, monitors, printers, VOIP phones, and other shared equipment.
â€¢ Document processes and issues and manage their inventory.
â€¢ Onboard and offboard users and manage user accounts and access.

Why we are excited about you â€¦
â€¢ You are an excellent communicator and have experience working with non-technical users.
â€¢ You are proactive and curious, and are eager to learn.
â€¢ You are an IT generalist and enjoy having a variety of work and responsibilities.

Requirements ...
â€¢ Degree or diploma in an IT-related field.
â€¢ Minimum 3 years of experience in IT Support or similar role.
â€¢ Certifications such as CompTIA A+, MCITP, or CCNA are an asset.
â€¢ Strong knowledge of Windows 11, Office 365, and Azure environments.
â€¢ Excellent organizational, documentation, and communication skills.
â€¢ Experience in financial services or insurance is an asset.

Compensation and Benefits ...

This company has an extensive total compensation package. This includes a bonus program, health spending account, share purchase plan, professional development reimbursement, pension plan, and a generous vacation policy.

Does this role sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and letâ€™s explore this together.

title: IT Support Technician
description:
Overview
We are seeking a dedicated IT Support Specialist to join our technology team. This role is vital in ensuring the seamless operation of our IT infrastructure, providing technical assistance to users, and maintaining system integrity. The ideal candidate will possess strong troubleshooting skills, a solid understanding of various operating systems, and excellent communication abilities to deliver exceptional customer service. This position offers an opportunity to work with diverse technologies including Windows, macOS, Linux, and network systems, supporting a dynamic and innovative environment.

Responsibilities
â€¢ Provide technical support for hardware, software, and network issues across multiple operating systems including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
â€¢ Troubleshoot and resolve desktop support issues related to software applications such as Microsoft Office and other productivity tools.
â€¢ Assist users with VPN configurations, firewall settings, and LAN connectivity to ensure secure and reliable access.
â€¢ Manage and resolve service requests using ServiceNow, Jira, BMC Remedy, and other ticketing systems.
â€¢ Support computer networking tasks including LAN setup, troubleshooting network connectivity problems, and configuring network devices.
â€¢ Perform hardware diagnostics, repairs, and upgrades on desktops, laptops, and peripheral devices.
â€¢ Maintain documentation of support activities and system configurations for future reference.
â€¢ Collaborate with team members to escalate complex issues when necessary and ensure timely resolution.
â€¢ Communicate effectively with end-users to provide clear instructions and updates on issue resolution status.

Requirements
â€¢ Proven experience in IT support or help desk roles with a strong understanding of operating systems such as Windows, macOS, and Linux.
â€¢ Familiarity with computer networking concepts including LAN setup, firewall configuration, and VPN access.
â€¢ Experience with software troubleshooting for common applications like Microsoft Office suite.
â€¢ Knowledge of service management tools such as ServiceNow, Jira, BMC Remedy is preferred.
â€¢ Ability to troubleshoot hardware components including desktops, laptops, and peripherals.
â€¢ Strong communication skills with a focus on delivering excellent customer service.
â€¢ Basic understanding of computer security practices including firewall management and network security protocols.
â€¢ Certifications or experience with operating system deployment or BMC Remedy administration are a plus. This role is ideal for motivated individuals passionate about technology support who thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy helping others resolve technical challenges efficiently.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $70,641.27 per year

Benefits:

â€¢ Employee assistance program
â€¢ Paid time off
â€¢ RRSP match
â€¢ Vision care

title: IT Program CoordinatorIT Support Specialist & Project Coordinator
description:
Department: IT

Reports to: IT Manager / CTO

OVERVIEW

Weâ€™re looking for a tech-savvy and detail-oriented IT Support Specialist & Project Coordinator to join our team at the intersection of technology and creativity. In this hybrid role, youâ€™ll provide day-to-day support to our staff by resolving technical issues quickly and professionally, while also taking on project coordination responsibilities to support broader IT initiatives.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and is looking to grow their impact beyond the help desk.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
â€¢ Provide Tier 1 and Tier 2 support for ~200 users across Linux, Windows, and Mac environments.
â€¢ Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, network, and account-related issues.
â€¢ Handle user onboarding/offboarding, asset deployment, and access provisioning.
â€¢ Maintain accurate records in asset management and ticketing systems.
â€¢ Coordinate and help manage IT projects (e.g., system upgrades, equipment rollouts, software adoption).
â€¢ Communicate project timelines and progress to stakeholders across creative, production, development, and administrative teams.
â€¢ Assist in documenting processes, procedures, and project plans.
â€¢ Maintaining and documenting asset inventory: hardware, software
â€¢ Receiving merchandise and checking delivery slips
â€¢ Collaborates with the Accounting team to process purchase orders (POs) and track IT-related expenditures.

REQUIREMENTS
â€¢ 2â€“4 years of experience in an IT support/help desk role.
â€¢ Familiarity with Linux, macOS and Windows, Google Workspace, and basic networking concepts.
â€¢ Exposure to project coordination or task tracking tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, Trello).
â€¢ Experience in M&E is a plus.
â€¢ Excellent interpersonal skills: able to support both technical and non-technical users with patience and clarity.
â€¢ Highly organized, self-motivated, and comfortable juggling multiple priorities.

Bonus Skills:
â€¢ Experience supporting remote workforce (e.g. PCoIP).
â€¢ Familiarity with cloud systems.
â€¢ Familiarity with containerization (e.g. Docker, Podman)
â€¢ Knowledge of scripting or automation tools (e.g., Intune, Bash, Python, PowerShell) is a plus but not required.

If this sounds like you, please submit your cover letter, resume and demo reel to careers@spinvfx.com. Be sure to include â€œIT Support Specialist & Project Coordinatorâ€ in the subject line.

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Toronto, ON M5V 3H5

title: IT Support Specialist - Hybrid Downtown Toronto
description:
**Supercharge your career at Nucleus Networks!**

What makes Nucleus different from other Managed IT Services providers? To start, our focus goes beyond just keeping the lights on. We work with every one of our clients to help supercharge their business, transforming their IT from a system that just needs support to one that is driving business results and helping them grow. We are one of BCâ€™s top 5 Best Workplaces and a top 5 Finalist for BCâ€™s Best Company, we pride ourselves on our culture, our unique approach to delivering rapid-response IT services, and our continued obsession with providing the best client experience possible.

We are a team of over 80 experienced IT Professionals focused on providing industry-leading IT Services to clients across Canada. With operations in BC, AB and ON, Nucleus has adopted a hybrid work model, allowing the majority of roles to work from anywhere as we have employees based all around the world.

Weâ€™ve also been recognized as one of North Americaâ€™s top Managed IT Services Providers as well as one of the top ten MSPs in Canada. Our vision is to be the best MSP in Canada for SMBs and we are looking for talented people who want to be a part of our journey and help us get there!
â€¢ *Role Summary**

As the Technical Support Specialist, you will serve as the front line of technical support, responsible for facilitating incoming calls and ensuring they are directed to the appropriate resources. This role is expected to bring awareness and recurring issues to their direct supervisor. Exceptional customer service and communication is critical as this role is going to be working with non-technical clients on a regular basis.
â€¢ *General Duties and Responsibilities**

- **Must be willing and able to commute to and work onsite 70-100% of the work week in downtown Toronto.**
- Monitor the call queue and ticket boards, and promptly address incoming calls and tickets.

- Maintain ticket hygiene by managing and completing tickets from initiation to resolution.

- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues according to established procedures and guidelines.

- Utilize knowledge base resources such as ITGlue; conduct external research and seek guidance from superiors and peers as needed.

- Update internal documentation through our knowledge base resources and other relevant systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date information.

- Collaborate with supervisors and appropriate stakeholders to ensure efficient use of resources which include seeking approval before initiating work on a solution, particularly for time-intensive tasks.

- Make decisions related to access permissions and prioritization of incoming tickets, ensuring high-priority issues are addressed promptly.

- Attend all required meetings, including Support Pod Huddles, one-on-one sessions, and team meetings.

- Maintain a deep knowledge of technology products and services applicable to the client base, including hardware, software and Nucleus services.

- Other duties as assigned.
â€¢ *Required Skills and Qualifications**

- **Must be willing and able to commute to and work onsite 70-100% of the work week in downtown Toronto.**
- A minimum high school diploma is required; post-secondary education in a related field is an asset.

- At least two years of IT industry or MSP experience.

- Must understand GPOs, Hyper-V, intermediate networking, Microsoft 365 and Active Directory.

- Must be able to go on-site as required depending on clientâ€™s needs.

- Must be comfortable analyzing technical issues and deciding whether the solution is efficient and feasible.

- Must be able to apply creative solution finding to address and resolve technical issues.

- Must be able to provide temporary workarounds that fall within company standards based on previous experience.

- Familiarity with knowledge base tools (e.g., ITGlue, ConnectWise Manage, ConnectWise Automate) is a plus.

- Excellent computer literacy skills and skills in MS Office Suite.

- Experience working with an ERP system is an asset.

- Ability to multi-task and prioritize and work independently.

- Ability to maintain confidential information.
â€¢ *Certifications**

Ideally, you already have the following certifications under your belt:

- Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900),

- Cisco Certified Support Technician (CCST) Certification,

- Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals.

Bonus points if you have one of the following certifications in addition to the ones above:

- Cisco Meraki Solutions Specialist (CMSS) Certification,

- Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104),

- Microsoft 365 Certified: Endpoint Administrator Associate.
â€¢ *Perks!**

- An award-winning culture and organization that focuses time and energy on YOU and fostering an awesome workplace
- Hybrid Remote Environment
- Monthly Staff Socials â€“ we offer an outgoing culture that provides lots of opportunities to connect with your co-workers
- Competitive Salary & Benefits
- Birthdays off!
â€¢ All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or age.*

title: IT Support Specialist II
description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by ðŸ‘‹

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Wellâ€¦ you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is seeking an
IT Support Specialist (Level 2)
to join our
IT Support team
. This role is based in
Toronto, Ontario
and requires working
on-site five days a week
at our Toronto office.

Reporting to the
Team Lead, IT Help Desk
, the IT Support Specialist (Level 2) is responsible for providing intermediate technical support to end-users, managing more complex technical issues, and assisting with IT projects. This role requires a deeper technical knowledge and the ability to handle a wider range of IT challenges.

What youâ€™ll be responsible for
:
â€¢ Be in charge of on/off-boarding and ensure the provision and repatriation of IT equipment.
â€¢ Maintain accurate records of hardware and software inventory (Backstore, A-V, Monitors, etc..)
â€¢ Ensure office desks & conferencing rooms are up to standard, functional and organized.
â€¢ Partner with Level 1 and 3 teammates to diagnose and troubleshoot main IT issues.
â€¢ Start assisting IT departments with basic configurations, initiatives, project involvement or monitoring under guidance (based on IDPs)
â€¢ Provide technical support to end-users and executive leadership.
â€¢ Educate end-users on IT best practices and provide technical training as needed.
â€¢ Ensures that SOX compliance tasks are followed rigorously
â€¢ Assist with routine IT maintenance tasks.
â€¢ Manage user access requests.
â€¢ Maintain knowledge of all IT compliance requirements and responsibilities.
â€¢ Collaborate with other teams inside and outside of IT on initiatives and issues.
â€¢ Maintain and update the organization's IT knowledge base.
â€¢ Train Level 1 technicians on new technologies and procedures.
â€¢ Work closely with the IT-Ops team to support the office.
â€¢ Basic Networking Knowledge ( VLAN, TCP, DHCP, IP/Mac addresses, switches and cable management)
â€¢ General knowledge of SOX Compliance is an asset.
â€¢ Requirement of being able to lift heavy objects ( maximum 50 lbs)

And a little bit of....
â€¢ Host large meetings and company events.
â€¢ Use excellent communication skills to interact clearly and confidently with executive leadership and business stakeholders.
â€¢ Contributing as part of the wider team to achieve organizational objectives even if this means doing things that arenâ€™t strictly within the scope of your role.

What youâ€™ll be bringing to the team:
â€¢ Education:
Associateâ€™s degree in Information Technology or a related field; relevant certifications such as CompTIA A+ or Network+ are preferred.
â€¢ Experience:
1â€“3 years of experience in IT support or helpdesk roles, ideally within a fast-paced or multi-site environment.
â€¢ Technical proficiency:
Strong working knowledge of both macOS and Windows operating systems, including setup, configuration, and troubleshooting.
â€¢ Device management:
Hands-on experience with MDM (Mobile Device Management) solutions for managing and securing company devices.
â€¢ Ticketing systems:
Experience using IT service management or ticketing tools (e.g., Jira Service Management, Zendesk, or ServiceNow) to track and resolve support requests efficiently.
â€¢ Communication:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues clearly to non-technical users.
â€¢ Customer focus:
Strong sense of ownership and accountability in providing timely, high-quality support to internal teams.

title: Junior Software Developer
description:
About Metergy Solutions Inc. (â€œMetergyâ€)

Metergy has the energy, rapid growth and excitement of a startup, together with a rock-solid, recession-proof business that has a 45 year track record. Weâ€™re a technology company that drives huge carbon emission reductions. This is a once-in-a-career opportunity.

As one of North Americaâ€™s most experienced submetering providers, Metergy has brought turnkey solutions to clients for over 45 years. Metergy supplies, installs and remotely reads meters to measure individual suite consumption of electricity, water, gas, and thermal energy in multi-residential and commercial buildings, and bills and collects for the cost of commodities and administrative charges for the services provided. The business model allows for long-term recurring revenue through an innovative Submetering as a Service (SaaS) model. Submetering is proven to reduce in-suite energy consumption by 40%, driving decarbonization efforts for Metergyâ€™s clients. This performance has enabled Metergy to issue green bonds and obtain green financing.

Positioned as the #1 submeter provider in the New York and Canadian markets, and one of the largest in North America, Metergy has more than 900,000 contracted meters, issues over 4M utility bills annually and has over 500 team members. Metergy is a portfolio company of Brookfield Infrastructure Partners. Brookfield is one of the worldâ€™s largest investors, owners and operators of infrastructure assets across the utilities, transport, energy, data and sustainable resources sectors. This sponsorship provides Metergy with access to large-scale capital, infrastructure investment expertise and global reach.

Our Mission

Provide building owners and occupants with accurate and reliable utility consumption data through market-leading expertise in turnkey submetering and billing, while fostering a workplace with inspired team members empowered to do more good.

At Metergy, we donâ€™t just believe in our people; we champion them. When individuals feel valued, supported, and inspired to grow, incredible things happen. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re thrilled to be recognized as a Great Place to Work for the second consecutive year! This achievement reflects our unwavering commitment to building a workplace thatâ€™s respectful, inclusive, and high-performing.

Come be part of a team that leads with passion, thrives on positivity, and delivers with precision. Weâ€™re proud of who we are and even prouder of where weâ€™re headed.

The Role

Metergy is currently undergoing a significant software development effort seeking to modernize its existing, legacy business systems into a modern, cloud- native solution. This effort touches every aspect of our business from autonomous management of meter points & data collection to customer onboarding, management and billing. We are seeking junior and intermediate software developers with a solid foundation in data manipulation and data engineering. The successful candidates will:

Responsibilities
â€¢ Update and expand existing services written in .NET (C#)
â€¢ Implement new Python-based data parsers for meter data of varying formats and commodities
â€¢ Analyze, transform, and action on parsed data using Azure Databricks
â€¢ Leverage Al-assisted development to augment their learning and development throughout the software development lifecycle.
â€¢ Collaborate with teams to enhance and refactor .NET-based services, ensuring maintainability and scalability
â€¢ Design, develop, and maintain Python scripts for parsing and processing large volumes of meter data
â€¢ Build and optimize data pipelines and workflows in Azure Databricks for data transformation, validation, and analytics
â€¢ Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and agile ceremonies with senior staff
â€¢ Write automated unit and integration tests for CI/CD pipelines
â€¢ Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve defects in both .NET and Python codebases
â€¢ Document solutions and contribute to overall solution architecture discussions

Qualifications
â€¢ Proficiency in C#/.NET (preferably .NET 6+), with experience updating or extending existing codebases
â€¢ Strong Python programming skills, especially for data parsing and transformation tasks
â€¢ Hands-on experience with data engineering concepts: ETL/ELT, data validation, and pipeline design
â€¢ Familiarity with Azure Databricks or similar cloud-based data platforms for large-scale data processing
â€¢ Experience with git-based source control (GitHub, GitLab, or Azure DevOps) Understanding of modern software development practices, including object- oriented design, dependency injection, and event-driven architectures
â€¢ Ability to communicate effectively and collaborate in a team environment

Nice to Have
â€¢ Experience with PostgreSQL, Azure Data Factory, or other Azure data services
â€¢ Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and cloud-native application patterns
â€¢ Exposure to data validation, estimation, and editing pipelines (e.g., VEE for meter data)

Benefits & Perks
â€¢ Fully company covered heath and dental benefits from day 1
â€¢ Company funded Health Spending Account
â€¢ Plan for retirement with Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP) and RRSP Matching
â€¢ Grow with us! We provide support for continuous learning.
â€¢ Paid personal and sick days on top of your vacation
â€¢ Summer hours to enjoy the weather
â€¢ Company sponsored social events & more!

This posting is for an existing vacancy.

Metergy does not use artificial intelligence (AI) to screen, assess, or select candidates.

Our recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities. All accommodations will consider the applicantâ€™s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
This is a 100% full-time position based in our spacious office in Toronto at Yonge-Sheppard.

About PheedLoop:
PheedLoop is a Toronto based software company that is revolutionizing the events and conferences industry. From building innovative software to modernize and automate events, to virtual event technology, to custom hardware, our success has been thanks to our amazing engineering team. Located in the Toronto, PheedLoop is one of the world's fastest-growing event technology companies.
PheedLoop isn't like other startups out there. We're a bootstrapped company that has been profitable since day one. We're growing quickly but sustainably and are looking for new team members to own some brand new exciting features to come. Weâ€™re looking for someone comfortable with diving through the entire stack to solve problems and keen enough to learn whatever is necessary to do so. Weâ€™re also a small and close-knit team so beyond just engineering, having an interest in the rest of the company and a collaborative mindset is a must.

Your Day to Day:

â€¢ Use logging and monitoring tools to identify, troubleshoot and fix issues.

Who We're Looking For:

We want to work with people who are looking to grow personally and professionally. Working on a small team, you will have a massive impact and a lot of responsibility very quickly. Your work, just like everyone else's at PheedLoop, will make a massive difference.

title: Software Engineer, Data Engineering
description:
Join us in building the future of finance.

Our mission is to democratize finance for all. An estimated $124 trillion of assets will be inherited by younger generations in the next two decades. The largest transfer of wealth in human history. If youâ€™re ready to be at the epicenter of this historic cultural and financial shift, keep reading.

About the team + role

With a strong and growing engineering hub in Toronto, our teams in Canada are essential to building exceptional financial products and supporting our mission to democratize finance for all.

Robinhood is a metrics driven company and data is foundational to all key decisions from growth strategy to product optimization to our day-to-day operations. We are looking for a Software Engineer, Data Engineering to build and maintain foundational datasets that will allow us to reliably and efficiently power decision making at Robinhood. These datasets include application events, database snapshots, and the derived datasets that describe and track Robinhood's key metrics across all products. Youâ€™ll partner closely with engineers, data scientists and business teams to power analytics, experimentation, and machine learning use cases. We are a fast-paced team in a fast growing company and this is a unique opportunity to help lay the foundation for reliable, impactful, data-driven decisions across the company for years to come.

The role is located in the office location(s) listed on this job description which will align with our in-office working environment. Please connect with your recruiter for more information regarding our in-office philosophy and expectations.

What Youâ€™ll Do
â€¢ Help define and build key datasets across all Robinhood product areas. Lead the evolution of these datasets as use cases grow.
â€¢ Build scalable data pipelines using Python, Spark and Airflow to move data from different applications into our data lake.
â€¢ Partner with upstream engineering teams to enhance data generation patterns.
â€¢ Partner with data consumers across Robinhood to understand consumption patterns and design intuitive data models.
â€¢ Ideate and contribute to shared data engineering tooling and standards.
â€¢ Define and promote data engineering best practices across the company.

What You Bring
â€¢ 3+ years of professional experience building end-to-end data pipelines
â€¢ Hands-on software engineering experience, with the ability to write production-level code in Python for user-facing applications, services, or systems (not just data scripting or automation).
â€¢ Expert at building and maintaining large-scale data pipelines using open source frameworks (Spark, Flink, etc)
â€¢ Strong SQL (Presto, Spark SQL, etc) skills.
â€¢ Experience solving problems across the data stack (Data Infrastructure, Analytics and Visualization platforms)
â€¢ Expert collaborator with the ability to democratize data through actionable insights and solutions.

Bonus Points
â€¢ Passion for working and learning in a fast-growing company.

title: Junior Application Developer
description:
Position Description

Purpose of the Job:

We are seeking a motivated developer to support design, development, and deployment of innovative software solutions, with a strong emphasis on AI-driven tools and applications. This role is ideal for a curious and growth-oriented individual eager to expand their expertise in modern development environments. The successful candidate will work with cloud platforms, AI/ML technologies, and full-stack frameworks, gaining hands-on experience with cutting-edge AI capabilities while contributing to mission-critical business initiatives.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
â€¢ Assist in developing, testing, and deploying applications using Python, React, and Tailwind CSS.
â€¢ Work with Azure AI tools and services, contributing to AI model integration and automation solutions.
â€¢ Contribute to backend development using .NET technologies such as C#, ASP.NET Core, and Entity Framework, supporting scalable enterprise solutions.
â€¢ Support and maintain non-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB, Azure Cosmos DB) for flexible data storage and retrieval.
â€¢ Leverage Azure services including Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure DevOps to enhance cloud-native application development and deployment.
â€¢ Support the design and maintenance of relational databases (SQL Server and Oracle).
â€¢ Create and maintain reports and dashboards in Power BI, learning data visualization best practices.
â€¢ Participate in the development and experimentation of machine learning models.
â€¢ Work closely with senior developers to troubleshoot, debug, and optimize solutions.
â€¢ Collaborate in Agile/Scrum teams, contributing to sprint planning, stand-ups, and code reviews.
â€¢ Familiar with various authentication providers such as Firebase Authentication, Auth0, and Azure Active Directory for secure user access and identity management.

Qualifications
â€¢ A bachelorâ€™s degree in information technology / computer science or related disciplines e.g. Engineering
â€¢ 1 -2 years of experience are preferred.
â€¢ Strong foundational knowledge of Python and modern JavaScript frameworks (React).
â€¢ Experience with Tailwind CSS for responsive UI design.
â€¢ Familiarity with SQL Server and Oracle relational databases.
â€¢ Exposure to Azure services; understanding of Azure AI tools is an advantage.
â€¢ Knowledge of .NET framework considered a strong asset.
â€¢ Willingness to learn Power BI for reporting and visualization.
â€¢ Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and enthusiasm to learn AI/ML development.
â€¢ Strong problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills.
â€¢ Passion for continuous learning and growth in modern development technologies.

Company Overview

Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. In North America, Sercoâ€™s 9,000+ employees strive to make an impact every day across 100+ sites in the areas of Defense, Citizen Services, and Transportation. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state, provincial and local governments, and commercial clients. While your place may look a little different depending on your role, we know you will find yours here. Wherever you work and whatever you do, we invite you to discover your place in our world. title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
In most companies, traditional customer support is often plagued by inefficiency and mediocrity. Support engineers frequently waste time on repetitive tasks or struggle with problems outside their narrow expertise. Data shows that over 60% of tickets get escalated because the first line of defense lacks the skills or knowledge to resolve them.

At Trilogy, we donâ€™t do traditional. Managing over 100 enterprise software products, weâ€™ve redefined customer support with advanced AI. Most issues are handled by our AI-powered chatbot, leaving only the most complex challenges for our engineers. That means every ticket you touch is difficult, varied, and requires creative problem-solving.

In this role, thereâ€™s no time for hand-holding or â€œlearning the ropesâ€ at a leisurely pace. If you need constant guidance, struggle to self-learn, or tend to ask obvious questions, you wonâ€™t last two weeks. Success requires a proactive mindset, the ability to adapt quickly, and the drive to figure things out independently.

If youâ€™re ready to step up and tackle the toughest problems in customer support, this role will accelerate your growth like nothing else. Youâ€™ll gain unparalleled technical expertise across a massive product portfolio while contributing directly to Trilogyâ€™s reputation for excellence. If you are up to the task of pushing your limits, weâ€™d love to see you apply.

What you will be doing
â€¢ AI-Augmented Customer Resolutions: Analyze complex tickets escalated by AI systems, apply human expertise to areas where AI falls short, and then close the gap by improving the AI system

What you wonâ€™t be doing
â€¢ Taking two whole months to get up to speed; you will be expected to ramp up one several products within the first month (we are aware this is aggressive)
â€¢ Relying on your managers for help; if you are not adept at unblocking yourself, you will likely struggle in this role

L2 Customer Support Engineer key responsibilities
â€¢ Integrate technical human expertise and AI capabilities to deliver exceptional customer support, focusing on complex issues that AI cannot yet fully resolve

Basic Requirements
â€¢ At least 3 total years of experience in a technical customer support role
â€¢ Advanced generative AI proficiency (i.e., use of multiple AI tools, ability to automate workflows and custom GPTs); if you've only used LLMs for research, learning, brainstorming, or content generation, that will be deemed insufficient

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

title: Application Technical Support
description:
**Lotek Wireless** is an award winning and world leader in the development, manufacture and marketing of fish and wildlife monitoring systems. Our innovative and internationally recognized radio, acoustic, archival and satellite monitoring solutions allow researchers to track animals, birds and fish of almost any size, in almost any environment.

Our craft is biotelemetry technology; our passion is the environment. We are committed to providing innovative solutions for a sustainable future. Whether an animal moves through a terrestrial, freshwater, marine or avian habitat, Lotek has a system to track it.

Leading researchers around the world rely on Lotek telemetry equipment and expertise. We are proud to be partners in fish and wildlife research being conducted in more than 100 countries - on every continent and in every ocean.
â€¢ *_The Opportunity: _**

We are seeking a highly motivated **_Applications Technical Support_** individual to join our team in Newmarket. This role is specifically for the Wildlife Segment. You will have the ability to interact with professional staff and clients on a technical basis both in an office and a field environment.
â€¢ *_Requirements: _**

This position requires an individual with a minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Applied Science, or equivalent experience. Electro-Technologists with suitable experience will also be considered. Biological/Environmental sciences experience or Programming and embedded firmware development experience would be an asset.
â€¢ *_Duties: _**

Develop a comprehensive knowledge of Satellite/GPS equipment produced and sold by Lotek.

Demonstrated ability to document, track, troubleshoot and resolve complex and time sensitive issues.

Maintain test equipment in good working condition.
â€¢ *_What we Offer: _**

Competitive compensation and incentive package

Company paid Benefit Plan that includes life insurance, AD&D, Short and long
- term disability, health and dental care

Employee Assistance Program

Outstanding company culture including a Social Committee that organizes monthly events, contests, BBQâ€™s, and more.

Milestone Anniversary Awards

Paid holidays, sick leave entitlement and Bonus Day

Tuition re-imbursement

Training, support and collaborative teamwork
â€¢ *_To apply: _**

If you are looking for an exciting new opportunity with a leading-edge company, please send us your resume.

Lotek Wireless Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs through the recruitment process.

Please note only those persons invited for an interview will be contacted.

To find more out about Lotek go to our Facebook, Youtube page or visit our website.
â€¢ *Benefits**:

- Company events
- Dental care
- Disability insurance
- Employee assistance program
- Extended health care
- Life insurance
- On-site parking
- Paid time off
- Tuition reimbursement
- Wellness program

title: IT Support Technician
description:
Overview
We are seeking a dedicated IT Support Specialist to join our technology team. This role is vital in ensuring the seamless operation of our IT infrastructure, providing technical assistance to users, and maintaining system integrity. The ideal candidate will possess strong troubleshooting skills, a solid understanding of various operating systems, and excellent communication abilities to deliver exceptional customer service. This position offers an opportunity to work with diverse technologies including Windows, macOS, Linux, and network systems, supporting a dynamic and innovative environment.

Responsibilities
â€¢ Provide technical support for hardware, software, and network issues across multiple operating systems including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
â€¢ Troubleshoot and resolve desktop support issues related to software applications such as Microsoft Office and other productivity tools.
â€¢ Assist users with VPN configurations, firewall settings, and LAN connectivity to ensure secure and reliable access.
â€¢ Manage and resolve service requests using ServiceNow, Jira, BMC Remedy, and other ticketing systems.
â€¢ Support computer networking tasks including LAN setup, troubleshooting network connectivity problems, and configuring network devices.
â€¢ Perform hardware diagnostics, repairs, and upgrades on desktops, laptops, and peripheral devices.
â€¢ Maintain documentation of support activities and system configurations for future reference.
â€¢ Collaborate with team members to escalate complex issues when necessary and ensure timely resolution.
â€¢ Communicate effectively with end-users to provide clear instructions and updates on issue resolution status.

Requirements
â€¢ Proven experience in IT support or help desk roles with a strong understanding of operating systems such as Windows, macOS, and Linux.
â€¢ Familiarity with computer networking concepts including LAN setup, firewall configuration, and VPN access.
â€¢ Experience with software troubleshooting for common applications like Microsoft Office suite.
â€¢ Knowledge of service management tools such as ServiceNow, Jira, BMC Remedy is preferred.
â€¢ Ability to troubleshoot hardware components including desktops, laptops, and peripherals.
â€¢ Strong communication skills with a focus on delivering excellent customer service.
â€¢ Basic understanding of computer security practices including firewall management and network security protocols.
â€¢ Certifications or experience with operating system deployment or BMC Remedy administration are a plus. This role is ideal for motivated individuals passionate about technology support who thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy helping others resolve technical challenges efficiently.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $70,641.27 per year

Benefits:
â€¢ Dental care
â€¢ Employee assistance program
â€¢ Paid time off
â€¢ RRSP match
â€¢ Vision care

Work Location: In person

title: IT Support Officer
description:
About IBU

International Business University (IBU) stands as Ontario's first independent not-for-profit university. Having received Ministerial consent for full accreditation in 2020 and DLI approval in 2023, IBU is Ontario's only not-for-profit independent University. Our foundation draws inspiration from the world's most esteemed independent universities, creating a 'next generation' model characterized by innovation, agility, and responsiveness. IBU is focused on being a truly student-centric, industry-aligned university, executing the best practices of today to build the future talent relevance of tomorrow. IBU is committed to curricula and learning experiences that seamlessly blend rigorous academic preparation with practical skill development, reflecting emerging technologies, evolving societal needs, and the future demands of the global workforce.

Job Title: IT Support Officer

Term: Full-time, Indefinite (40 hours/week)

Department: IT

Reports to: Director of IT

Location: Toronto, Ontario

The IT Support Officer will be responsible for the planning and delivery of student, faculty, and employee IT support services, managing support staff and providing high quality customer service. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing services such as installation, consultation, troubleshooting, user assistance and training. Functions may include diagnosing and resolving problems in response to customer reported incidents; planning and analysis of work processes; researching and reporting trends and patterns of problems; developing training materials and performing information system training sessions; developing and maintaining problem tracking IT case; installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining hardware and software; performing backup and recovery operations; consulting with users to identify needs and requirements; conducting feasibility studies and trade-off analyses; preparing business cases; ensuring the rigorous application of information security/information assurance policies, principles, and practices.

Key Responsibilities:

Reporting to the IT Director, the successful candidate will be required to perform the following job duties including but not limited to:
â€¢ Design and implement IT service and helpdesk platform based on ITIL frameworks, enable the IT service level agreement to meet our customer and students' expectations.
â€¢ Lead the Tier 1 IT co-op support to provide the end-users service on hardware and software systems.
â€¢ Resolve routine end-user issues in a timely manner through established protocol and troubleshooting; escalate as necessary.
â€¢ Provide guidance and explain policies and procedures to end-users.
â€¢ Assist users in obtaining access to systems.
â€¢ Utilize and maintain knowledge bases, white papers, FAQs, and vendor documentation.
â€¢ Contribute to documentation of incidents, internal processes and procedures, maintenance of equipment, and training manuals.

Qualifications:

The successful candidate shall possess the following skills:
â€¢ Proficient in the following software
â€¢ Microsoft Windows 10 & 11 / MacOS
â€¢ Microsoft Office 365
â€¢ Salesforce Service Cloud or/and Jira Service Management, Freshworks
â€¢ Canvas LMS
â€¢ McGraw Hill Connect
â€¢ Proficient in the following hardware:
â€¢ Lenovo ThinkPad / ThinkCentre / MacBook
â€¢ Cisco Meraki
â€¢ Video and Audio Devices
â€¢ MFP (Multi-functional Printer)
â€¢ Projector
â€¢ Cabling

The successful candidate shall possess the following qualifications:
â€¢ Bachelor's Degree and/or college diploma in Information Technology or related field.
â€¢ Minimum of three (3) years related experience in IT or related field (required).
â€¢ Strong communication skills.
â€¢ Adept at problem-solving.
â€¢ Well-developed decision making, prioritization and problem-solving skills.

Application Packages should contain the following:
â€¢ A cover letter
â€¢ A current CV

Note: Application materials should be submitted as a single combined PDF file, with a file name that identifies the applicant.

All applications must be submitted electronically to careers@ibu.ca. Applications received by 4:00 pm EST December 20, 2025 will be assured of consideration, though the posting remains open until the position is filled. The position is subject to budgetary approval. Any questions may be sent to careers@ibu.ca

International Business University values and embraces diversity, equality and inclusion as fundamental to our mission to educate students for career success in the business world today. Our desire is to ensure that our institution is a welcoming, inclusive, respectful, and safe environment for everyone. IBU is dedicated to fostering diversity and inclusivity within our community and is an equal-opportunity employer. We invite and encourage applications from all qualified individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our Institution, including equity-deserving groups that are traditionally underrepresented in employment (Indigenous peoples, racialized persons, women, persons with disabilities, and 2SLGBTQQIPA+ persons).

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, upon request, accommodation will be provided by International Business University throughout the recruitment, selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.

The ideal candidate will have over 8 years of experience in technical support or software engineering, and be adept in debugging code in languages like Python and JavaScript. Responsibilities include active participation in support requests and engaging with the developer community. A base salary of $165,000 CAD is expected, alongside additional benefits.

title: Lead, Tech Support
description:
Overview:

We are currently looking for a lead tech support colleague to join the team in Toronto as part of our Global IT Service Desk. The Lead, Tech Support will be responsible for providing top-tier technical support to our engineering team, C-suite, and in-office and remote employees. Responsibilities will include troubleshooting and resolving complex issues, as well as providing outstanding customer service and training. Additionally, the Lead, Tech Support will be responsible for maintaining our IT infrastructure, handling basic networking issues, and working closely with remote teams and global counterparts to develop solutions that will improve system performance.

This position will be hybrid out of our Toronto office.

What You'll Do:
â€¢ Provide comprehensive, top-tier support to both remote and onsite employees with an emphasis on customer service, including troubleshooting software, hardware, mobile devices, and network related issues
â€¢ Launch and maintain the new Toronto office's infrastructure, support engineering, and assist local employees with their various needs
â€¢ Maintain support duties through an online ticket management system
â€¢ Employ Microsoft admin portals like Azure AD / Entra and Endpoint Configuration Manager / Intune for managing security groups related to access, SSO, and application deployment
â€¢ Maintain a knowledge base consisting of documentation and administration procedures
â€¢ Participate in mitigation of email-based threats through use of industry-adopted security tools like Microsoft Defender; responsibilities include releasing or recategorizing emails and submitting them for review and reclassification by Microsoft when incorrectly flagged as a threat
â€¢ Troubleshoot issues with video conferencing rooms and equipment, ensuring all systems function optimally for seamless virtual meetings and presentations
â€¢ Coordinate with Human Resources, Endpoint, and M365 Service teams for the onboarding and offboarding of employees
â€¢ Engage in the management of the asset lifecycle, encompassing the shipping and receiving, which may require occasional visits to FedEx for the expedited transport of laptops to meet tight deadlines

What You Have:
â€¢ 10+ years of experience providing IT support in a corporate office environment
â€¢ Significant experience and proficiency using and administering the Microsoft 365 suite of applications, plus Windows 10 / 11
â€¢ Familiarity with Microsoft admin centers such as Azure AD / Entra, Endpoint Manager / Intune, and Security
â€¢ Confident troubleshooting common to complex networking issues
â€¢ Excellent customer service orientation, communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a small team environment
â€¢ Capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced atmosphere, with a positive and proactive attitude

Nice to Have:
â€¢ Experience troubleshooting Mac OS / JAMF
â€¢ Experience Windows Autopilot
â€¢ Experience with Microsoft Teams Rooms setup and troubleshooting
â€¢ Experience with Intune for mobile device and application management

You will also be eligible for the following benefits:
â€¢ Paid time off
â€¢ Comprehensive benefits plan
â€¢ Company RRSP match
â€¢ Development opportunities through the LinkedIn Learning platform

About Guidepoint:

Guidepoint is a leading research enablement platform designed to advance understanding and empower our clients' decision-making process. Powered by innovative technology, real-time data, and hard-to-source expertise, we help our clients to turn answers into action.

Backed by a network of nearly 1.75 million experts and Guidepoint's 1,600 employees worldwide, we inform leading organizations' research by delivering on-demand intelligence and research on request. With Guidepoint, companies and investors can better navigate the abundance of information available today, making it both more useful and more powerful.

At Guidepoint, our success relies on the diversity of our employees, advisors, and client base, which allows us to create connections that offer a wealth of perspectives. We are committed to upholding policies that contribute to an equitable and welcoming environment for our community, regardless of background, identity, or experience.
